dt: {bc}of, relating to, or being chemical or environmental precursors of the origin of life

dt.t: … it is possible that either the {wi}prebiotic{/wi} molecules necessary for the evolution of life or the raw materials from which these molecules formed were brought to Earth by comet-like objects.

dt: {bc}existing or occurring before the origin of life

dt.t: … RNA is a chemically fragile molecule, unlikely to survive the harsh {wi}prebiotic{/wi} conditions.
… next-generation probiotic microbes administered along with the appropriate {wi}prebiotic{/wi} nutrients to nourish them.

shortdef: of, relating to, or being chemical or environmental precursors of the origin of life; also : existing or occurring before the origin of life
of, relating to, or being a prebiotic

dt: {bc}a substance and especially a carbohydrate (such as {d_link|inulin|inulin}) that is nearly or wholly indigestible and that when consumed (as in food) promotes the growth of beneficial bacteria in the digestive tract

dt.t: {wi}Prebiotics{/wi} are naturally found in certain fruits, vegetables, and herbs, including artichoke, asparagus, bananas, chicory, garlic, and onions.

shortdef: a substance and especially a carbohydrate (such as inulin) that is nearly or wholly indigestible and that when consumed (as in food) promotes the growth of beneficial bacteria in the digestive tract
